title: Who was the most unique president in history? - Quora
tags: Presidential History of the United States of America
Political History of the United States of America
Presidents of the United States of America
History of the United States of America
Politics of the United States of America

response.answer_text: Quick answer: Donald Trump. Who is more unique than this guy. Oh wait you asked who was: that might be Andrew Jackson. What other president defied the Supreme Court? when he was ruled against on moving the Cherokee westward? Jackson allegedly said: “Does the Supreme Court have an army? And the Indians went west tearfully and tragically.

I understand uniqueness to be aa binary matter. One is either unique or one is not. I don’t know what the metric would be by which one can describe one human being, inclusive of a US President, as more unique than another, unless only one IS unique and the others are all fungible. And I don’t believe that is the case. The opposite may well be the case.
